intro: Turnera trigona, commonly known as the golden turnera, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture with a slightly waxy surface. Turnera trigona is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant color and tropical appearance.
